title: How to Make Florentines

text: Mix the almonds, peel and cherries together.  Pour the butter in and mix well. Add the sugar and cream, then mix again. Leave to cool from the melted butter. Preheat the oven to 190ºC/375ºF.  Place a teaspoonful of mixture for each biscuit onto a baking tray lined with baking paper. Leave plenty of space for each biscuit as it tends to spread a lot. Place the tray in the oven. Bake for 6–8 minutes or until the biscuits turn a shade of pale golden brown at the edges. Take a round biscuit cutter and reshape the biscuits, while still warm, into perfect circles. Or, you can leave them as they are. Place onto a cooling rack and leave until completely cooled down.  Melt the chocolate in a double boiler. Spread the melted chocolate on the flat side (tray bottom side) of each biscuit and leave to settle in. Finished.
